website_summaries.verdict: Frisbee-shaped fetch toy that has the toughness of the KONG brand behind it.
pros: Consists of an extremely durable rubber that's made to last
Flying disc shape will maintain an accurate flight path, even for novices
Rubber disc will be softer for the dog to catch than a hard plastic disc
cons: Not made to be used as a chew toy for the dog, as the rubber may break

customer_reviews.title: Kong quality is going downhill!!
customer_reviews.text: We had the red Kong Frisbee for a very long time and finally our dogs ripped it so we got the "extreme" Kong thinking it would hold up even longer!! Ha!!! They have had this less than 30 minutes. I am so angry we wasted out money on this Frisbee which is supposed to be made for "extreme chewers" haha!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: The original flyer we found after we bought this but like any "kid" our dog wanted to play with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Kong Rubber Flyer at a brick and morter about a year ago. We thought we lost it so we bought this on Amazon because it was about $10 cheaper. There is no way this is an original Kong Flyer OR Kong has dramatically reduce the ruggedness of the product. The original flyer we found after we bought this but like any "kid" our dog wanted to play with the new toy. He had a hold in it in less than 10 minutes and torn in half in 30. The original flyer, the one we thought we lost, IS STILL IN TACT.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Braap and Boop! approved.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only Frisbee that has held up with these two! Braap will catch Frisbees 24/7 if allowed. But when we make him quit, he and little sister will play tug of war, or run along side-by-side with it. We have tried dozens of others, before finding these. They are great flyers, perfect material (not too hard for pup’s mouth) and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Phatgal

customer_reviews.title: Lasted two hours
customer_reviews.text: I love Kong products for my Labrador and have never had an issue. Even her Kong ball with slots so I can pump peanut butter in them doesn’t have a scratch after countless uses over five years. I got her this Kong frisbee, it arrived yesterday and is already in the trash. She shredded it within hours. A total waste of money. I’ll just continue to buy her the $1.00 frisbees from Petsmart. At least this way if she chews thru it then I did t spend $10 thinking it was made for heavy chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Mellisa

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs favorite
customer_reviews.text: We no longer can say the word "frisbee" in our household without getting our dog super excited. He loves chasing and catching frisbees. These King disks are great because they will not destroy the teeth of the dog, they fly nicely and are durable. Our dog is rather rough chaser and we go through approximately 5-10 Kong frisbees per year, which is not that much when considering that we use the discs during up to four 20 minutes lasting disc sessions per week.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous123

customer_reviews.title: Floppier than I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is a very soft floppy rubber. It does fly and took a little while for my dog to realize what she was supposed to do, but she does want to chew on it as well. I think if she ever got ahold of it for a while she would be able to destroy it. I don't think this will fly as far as a stiffer disc either, but we'll have to wait until my pup gets the hang of catching it before we can test that out. Right now you have to throw it directly to her or it just hits the ground before she can get it. ...working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Meridsalk

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back
customer_reviews.text: My cattle dog puppy had this thing ripped within minutes. I want to train him to be a disc dog, and went with this to be easy on his mouth while he is learning. I turned my head for a few seconds, and chunks were gone. I’m normally a big fan of Kong, and had big plans for this, so I was really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jg5

customer_reviews.title: Durable for moderate chewers
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised by the hate on this product. And at the same time not surprised that owners with extremely aggressive chewer leaving negative reviews on products that aren’t meant for their dog. This is made of a soft rubber. It will not hold up to aggressive chewing, and it isn’t a tugging toy. I bought this toy for my dog Christmas 2017, And it has held up 2 years later. My dog will fold it up like a taco and shake it. It still lies flat and intact. She is a moderately aggressive chewer. She does destroy certain toys.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cothran

customer_reviews.title: Chewed through the thickest part in less than 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than 10 minutes with our boxer mix. Much thinner than anticipated. We have 5 or 6 other Kong Extreme products and we still have 3 of the originals that he has yet to wear out. Unfortunately, this doesn't live up to the Kong Extreme brand at all. For some reason, it won't allow me to leave pictures on this review but if Kong wants to reach out to me I would be happy to provide them.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Seals

customer_reviews.title: Another great win for Kong in my book!!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, sturdy disc. THIS IS NOT INTENDED TO BE A FREAKING CHEW TOY SO THOSE OF YOU REVIEWING “it didn’t last for my power chewer” HELLO?! It’s a freaking frisbee, not a bone! You throw it and it works great! This frisbee is great for our trips to the dog park as it’s easily identifiable as ours and easy for our pup to find. My boyfriend loves throwing this thing and my pup loves catching it! What can I say? It’s a frisbee, its Kong brand, it’s exactly what you’d expect. I love it. (I bought the large for my 55 pound lab mix and that was definitely the right size for him.)
customer_reviews.author: Madeline’s Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Extreme? Extremely bypass this Kong Flyer.
customer_reviews.text: This is the Extreme Kong Flyer? It's super flimsy and super thin. It lasted 3 days with 2 Boxers and a Boxer mix. I've had the red one in the past and it lasted several months with these 3 furry kids. This must a joke that it's labeled as extreme and has "TOUGHEST NATURAL RUBBER" printed on the front of package. And an expensive mistake on my part...I didn't pay attention to where it was being sold and shipped from...the U.K. Kong, your products are going downhill. I expected more from something that says "MADE IN USA".
customer_reviews.author: Another Meriwether

customer_reviews.title: Great frisbee for an active dog
customer_reviews.text: These may be marketed as indestructible, however this is the 4th Kong flyer we have bought for our boxer. Somehow our dog is able to get a tear in the frisbee then manages to stand on it and pull until it tears. Sadly he is quite happy to run about with the rubber ring but he enjoys a round of frisbee every day and that ring does not fly. Before he manages to destroy the frisbee we have good fun with frisbee. This thing really flies so get used to chasing it in to neighboring yards.
customer_reviews.author: KrisDG

customer_reviews.title: Tough Enough!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this almost four years ago. My 70 lb Lab loved it from the beginning until this day. Still has same great shape and toughness. Play fetch, tug-o-war and even ran over it with my lawn mower (Riding Toro). Nothing can tear it up. After four years it is very dirt stained. A Dawn soaking doesn't even clean it anymore. So will buy a new one. My dog deserves it! Will keep the old one as a spare though. Only problem is it doesn't float! But my dog dives down to fetch it! We highly recommend it! Kali gave five paws up on that!
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves her Kong
customer_reviews.text: It is durable and a good flyer. I have a 100# GSD and the small is her favorite size. It lasts a long time under heavy use but it is not indestructible. She goes thru about 3 a yr. She is very hard on them and tears the middle eventually, but when not playing catch & retrieve she excavates the yard with it by standing on it with both front feet and trenching across her play yard. She catches, chews, shakes and shovels with her Kong and they do endure her punishment.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: The Best Money Can Buy
customer_reviews.text: The first time I bought this ~3 years ago, I got it at a dog store for $22. I thought it was crazy expensive but for the amount of $0.99 frisbees my dog had destroyed, it began to make sense. And this thing really is indestructible, there are teeth marks but that’s it, my dog LOVES it and it flys well. The only reason I’m here buying another is because she loved it so much I would let her lie on the floor and chew it.. so yeah, she inevitably destroyed it. But now it’s cheaper and I know what a great quality item it is. Happy to spend this money on my dogs happiness!
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: Don't last long, but longer than any other brand
customer_reviews.text: If my dog could play with this flyer all day long, he would. This is the only flyer he likes. I've purchased several other brands, and he only wants to catch this one. With that being said, unfortunately I have to purchase one of these probably every 3 months, due to the fact that they eventually either tear, rip, or get holes in them. Even with that happening, I still feel like I'm probably getting my monies worth, since we put a lot of miles on these flyers.
customer_reviews.author: P.M.

customer_reviews.title: Best dog toy and worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This frisbee is my dogs favorite toy! She plays with this frisbee every day and even sleeps with it. She carries it in her mouth all the time even playing tug-a-war most days. It has held up exceptionally well. This frisbee is flexible so it is easy to catch and hold. This is our third purchase of this same product. We wanted to have an extra since our dog loves it so much. The first finally tore after over a year of constant play outside and inside. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: MSblueMagnolia

customer_reviews.title: Buy the red one instead!
customer_reviews.text: Others have already written what I wish to stress.... It’s garbage compared to the red one!!!! It’s thin as paper almost. My dog had it ripped in three minutes flat! The red one is WAY stronger!!!! This is Kong’s way of ripping you off! They say it’s stronger. What a laugh! Buy the red one if you buy a Kong. Was really hoping the black one would be the same because black would be more UV resistant outside. What a kick in the pants to America because it’s made here!
customer_reviews.author: Sprinky183

customer_reviews.title: Color Matters -- Black Product All Bent and Wobbly, Not Even a Frisbee
customer_reviews.text: We have three red frisbees -- all on the roof and no grandchildren visiting to fetch through the upstairs bathroom window -- and they’re wonderful, hence THREE. But this time the red frisbees were more expensive so I went for a black, never questioning if it would be different. IT IS. It arrived in packaging folder over like a taco and has never recovered, despite hours in the heat. It will hardly throw. It’s all deformed and wobbles all over.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Destuctable, expensive
customer_reviews.text: Well, my dog loved it until it he punctured a hole in it and then he ripped the center out of it and now in less than a week there's not much left but he still carries it around with him and loves it 😁 It is not indestructible however and I think too expensive now that I've bought one and my German shepherd has had a chance to "test drive" it. I think if I got another one I would make sure that he brought it back immediately to me however that would probably mean having to retrieve it myself at times, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Durable and my dog loves it. Makes fetch fun for both of us.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my pit bull mix that is fetch obsessed. It lives outside in a covered spot and he is not allowed to tug or chew on it so it is still like new after a lot of use. It is softer rubber than a classic kong and sort of floppy but not so much that it is difficult to throw. I like that he can play fetch without cutting his lips like on a plastic frisbee and that it is easy to grab from him when he brings it back. I would buy it again but I don't see this wearing out for the foreseeable future.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Lynch

customer_reviews.title: This frisbee is one of my dog's favorite toys!
customer_reviews.text: 🐶🐾 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ It's softer on the teeth/mouth, heavier, and more floppy than most other frisbees. It flies just as well as one might hope or expect, and pretty accurate too. When playtime is over, however, I always put the frisbee up and out of reach. Considering the way my dog chews on other toys, I'm afraid it would not last otherwise. I'm very happy with my purchase, and I would gladly recommend this frisbee to another dog owner!
customer_reviews.author: K. L.

customer_reviews.title: I think your dog will love Kong
customer_reviews.text: My Australian blue heeler named Tank lives for the Kong frisbee. I have tried others but have not found any that meet his scrutinous approval. In his book Kong is King! I also have a Labrador who loves it . They are easy to throw with good balance for accuracy. The pliability and texture of product is what makes them their favorite. I should have bought stock in this company years back. Must have purchased 20 Kong flyers over the years. Typically get 3 to 4 months out of them playing on a daily basis before center comes out and all that is left is outer ring.
customer_reviews.author: George W.

customer_reviews.title: My 40lb cattle dog tore a hole in just 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for more out of this frisbee. It was pretty flexible and harder to throw than a plastic frisbee, but we adjusted to using it. However, in just over 3 months of use (only 1 month of heavy use because it was winter and we weren't using it a lot initially) my 40lb, 1year old cattle dog literally tore a 3-4inch hole right in the middle of it-the word KONG was completely ripped out. If your dog is any sort of chewer this won't last! As I write this review I do not see a place where I can upload a photo-if I can figure it out I will add one!
customer_reviews.author: SLS171

customer_reviews.title: Worth it. Great for all dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth between 1 star and 5 star reviews. I was very hesitant for its price. I got 2 different brand rubber frisbee (obviously this was one) my dogs LOVE this one. The other one is so so compared to this one. It's been about a month now and still no chew bites or anything. I don't know where these one star ratings came from (some said it lasted a few days). My dogs play tug of war with this and still great. Before they barely picked up a frisbee. Now they barely prefer the ball when we are outside.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: My dog is obsessed!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is obsessed with this!! She absolutely loves to run and catch this mid-air!! I can’t speak much to the durability, etc. because we do not let her chew on it and she only plays with it when we are outside with her - she does however try to play tug of war with it and shakes it like she’s trying to kill it and so far there is no damage to it which is impressive. I’m sure it wouldn’t take her long to destroy it, however she is like that with every toy we’ve ever bought her.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda K

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves playing with frisbee's but she often breaks them, this was a perfect solution, she plays with it by herself when we can't throw it for her too. She likes to shake it and run with it, it's also entertaining when she's running fast and it bends upward blocking her vision, she's a goof with it.
customer_reviews.author: megan Harper

customer_reviews.title: Epstein Didn’t Kill Himself
customer_reviews.text: I now only purchase Kong for our Saint Bernard, Zelda, who I’m convinced could chew through anything if given enough time. I’ve purchased multiple different frisbees for her and some of them lasted literal minutes before being rendered unusable. The cloth ones would be torn to shreds instantly and the hard plastic ones would be extremely warped within a day or two from her chewing on them so heavily. I’ve had the Kong Flyer for about three days so far and it’s still in one piece and throwable. I’ve purchased other products from Kong that didn't last as long as I had hoped, but so far I believe this one will stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not a chew toy!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun, if your dog will catch it and return with it. Do not let them chew on it! Especially if they are heavy chewers. Also, don't let them tug of war with it. Have 40, 50, and 70 pound dogs. If they get pulling on the frisbee, they will poke holes in it or rip it, if you let them go at it too long. My dogs have a hard bite, but if you only use this frisbee for supervised catch. It will last for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Garback

customer_reviews.title: Durable, well made toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made toy that my 90 lb Golden Retriever (Scarlett) has been playiing with for 3 months without much damage. Recently we adopted a 10 week, 17 lb Aussie (Rhett) who has managed to do more damage in a week to the toy then my Golden did. With him tugging on it daily, it is holding up remarkably well. I would recommend this toy and will more than likely purchase another one. KONG makes a great product and its locally made
customer_reviews.author: Dee Spain

customer_reviews.title: Great Frisbee, my dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent Frisbee (I got the small, red) and my dog (50 lb Lab) loves playing fetch with it. Despite being floppy rubber, it's easy to throw far. When we take it to the park it is a popular item among the dogs, and they will often play tug with it, I've seen as many as four dogs all biting down on this disc at once! It holds up very well to regular use and tug-of-war, but it is NOT a chew toy. Our first one was destroyed when I let our dog just sit and chew on it, within 15 minutes he had gnawed big chunks out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Ideal Food Dish
customer_reviews.text: Our little guy has emotional issues and is very jumpy. He is afraid of a regular metal or ceramic dish because if he nudges it, the dish moves and makes a noise and it scares him. This item has low sides, doesn’t slide all over the floor, and is soft. The first one finally got aged and stiff so this is the replacement. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Durable for SOME dogs
customer_reviews.text: This model lasts a long time with my son's miniature Australian Shepherd. For that I'd give it 5 stars. But when my daughter's Blue Heeler got a hold of it, he ripped it within 10 minutes, which sent my opinion plummeting. I generously left 3 stars because I'm not sure anything can withstand the crushing pressure of "Rocky" the Blue Heeler.
customer_reviews.author: Almighty God

customer_reviews.title: Over-rated.priced.  under-whelmed.
customer_reviews.text: For fetch its alright, way more flimsy than it looks in the advertising. The outside rim is durable so it rips apart in strips of the rim or triangles at the middle. Not recommended for any dog that can hold a strong grip. Lasted less than 2 days of fetch and retrieve before the first chunk ripped, then it was about every return another chunk would come off. My dogs drop the pieces and move to another toy, but this could be problematic for dogs who don't ignore small bits of toys
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Top quality - very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to buy a Kong product that I didn't love. I was a tad skeptical of this when I received it. It is very floppy. It, however, flies great and is easy for the puppy to pick up. The dog loves shaking it - and the floppyness of the Frisbee makes that adorable. Puppy teeth haven't damaged it yet. Highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Mac McD

customer_reviews.title: It smells really bad and the dog will not go for it. She like the cheap petsmart ones better
customer_reviews.text: I got the Frisbie for my lab who loves them. This one is soft and flexible but the smell is so bad she will not play with it. I washed it in the dishwasher and the smell will not go away. I bet it taste as bad as it smells. after a few days the toy smells toxic. tossed it out.. don't waste your money this is a China knock off.
customer_reviews.author: Ami

customer_reviews.title: Tore in half... after 70 days
customer_reviews.text: My 60 lb Golden Retriever/Lab 8 month old puppy loved this frisbee SO MUCH and initially it seemed durable, so we were stoked! A little after 2 months of almost daily play, it tore in half. We are SO SAD b/c this was his favorite toy. Very disappointed being that this is “KONG EXTREME” product, we thought it would hold up. (Note: We kept it indoors so it wasn’t sitting in the direct sun and it still broke. Their mfg guarantee is only for 60 days so we couldn’t make a claim.)
customer_reviews.author: Jaymie M.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2 year old Chocolate Lab and she loves this. Has a hard time picking it up so when she does it looks like lips. We are working on her catching it and us throwing it the right way. I would not leave this so the dog can chew it even thought it says they can't. We put it up and she knows where it's at and tells us every time we go outside
customer_reviews.author: KLJ

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: This frisbee has lasted much longer then a plastic one. My power chewing pit was able to chew some of the edge off in several areas but it still flies good and has even held up to her favorite game of tug-o-war. Even though she has customized it, it still flies good and keeps her entertained. I like how it is just the right amount of flimsy so she can fold it, run back to me and play tug. A very durable toy for the money and made with pride.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: No longer good
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this exact same product just a few months ago, I am on my third as of now. The first two were fantastic, the only reason I needed new ones is we lost the other two. BUT, this one is GARBAGE. My fog has already chewed a bit off. You can feel the BS made into this one. Apparently the Kong Company no longer wants to produce quality products. The other two were indestructible. This new one is flimsier and plain crap quality. When this one gets destroyed, I will look elsewhere for a proper dog product seeing as Kong no longer provides that.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Steffen

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs favorite toy, for sure! He is a 105lb pit/Rottweiler mix and can chew through anything. He has been able to puncture this frisbee, but they will last for several months, even if left outside. They are heavy-duty and fly perfectly! If left outside through all conditions, they will begin to weather after a few months making it easier for big dogs to tear apart. Just keep that in mind!
customer_reviews.author: SpeedCultureStudios

customer_reviews.title: I’m really just that happy after throwing $100s of dollars out the window to ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!!! THIS ACTUALLY STANDS UP TO MY DOGS RAZOR SHARP TEETH!!!! MY dog LOVES THIS TOY!!! All of these toys that say indestructible, or EXTRA STRONG for HEAVY CHEWERS, my dog rips apart in a matter of seconds. Literally 10-50 seconds. I swear her teeth have razor blades hidden in them... But they toy actually held up, in tact, no matter how hard she tried to destroy it.. And no, I did not receive any deals or compensation for my feedback. I’m really just that happy after throwing $100s of dollars out the window to finally have found toys that live true to their word...
customer_reviews.author: Marcia F.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing lasts forever against a determined dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog has the annoying tendency to try to rip these things up. For the Kong, after a couple weeks she always has managed to tear out the middle of it, leaving more of a ring. After that the damage stops, and she is even happier with it, because it's easier to play tug-o-war. Other flying disks get shredded, and are worthless after a week, at least the Kong one lasts for quite awhile, even as a hollow doughnut disk.
customer_reviews.author: R. McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Golden Retrievers that are 2 years old, this " extreme" kong frisbee lasted a total of 9 days before the center was ripped from side to side. The original red one lasted a lot longer. I would have given this zero stars if I could. Kong did a horrible job with this product, and then had the nerve to call it "extreme". Complete waste of money. Sorry picture is so bad.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C.

customer_reviews.title: The best frisbee for its cost/durability, hands down.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far my black mouth cur's favorite toy. It's rubber, surprisingly durable, and a good weight. I like the fact that I can throw it like a regular frisbee, but also have the option to roll it on the ground. For some reason, Scout's afraid to catch it while it's in the air but loves chasing it while it rolls/bounces on the ground and then snatching it. She's a 40-pound dog full of energy. We can play tug of war with this thing and it doesn't rip or tear. It is a truly durable toy that she loves.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbo Ross

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I'd read some reviews from people that had received sub-par quality and was a bit hesitant. BUT the frisbee I received is the usual top notch Kong quality. I have a 120lbs Cane Corso/Presa Canario mix. So, a mix of two of the breeds with the fiercest bite force among all dog breeds. My doggy will clamp down on it, shake it around like crazy, we even do some fun bite training with it. And the frisbee still has no damage whatsoever. I'm happy to recommend this frisbee, all the way up to the biggest, most powerful breeds.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Regut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy - could be more durable
customer_reviews.text: I would give these frisbees a 5 star rating if they were just a bit more durable. My 70 pound German Shepherd LOVES these frisbees and they're pretty much the only thing she'll play with. However, she goes through about 3 of them in a year. Our backyard has become a Kong frisbee graveyard. The weak point is, as expected, the middle of the frisbee. Without fail, she'll put a hole in the middle after a few months of use. Once the hole gets too big, it's very difficult to throw. To be fair, she does chew on them and play with them a lot, so it may be more than the expected use.
customer_reviews.author: TechTestimony

customer_reviews.title: My Heeler's Favorite, Though Not Really Super-Durable
customer_reviews.text: I have tested numerous frisbees with/for my extremely athletic Blue Heeler. The black Kong Flyer Extreme is by far his favorite. He disdains the red Kong Flyer. The black Kong's aerodynamic characteristics are superior to all other flexible frisbees we have tried. Hard plastic ones fly well, but he cracks or breaks them quickly. These do tend to shred around the "joint" on the edge, and remain intact only 4-6 weeks, when used regularly. Less than perfect, but no others suit him.
customer_reviews.author: Mark My Words

customer_reviews.title: Great for aggressive pups
customer_reviews.text: My little guy destroys all of his toys. KONG is good but he can tear through most. The black rubber (extreme) is my usual go to, however, this one was cheaper. Well, he loves it, it doesn't break anything in my home since it's soft, and he can go crazy with it but hasn't been able to tear it at all. One day, I hope we can use it as a frisbee... until then, it's the prefect chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Another great kong product, and the only frisbee you need
customer_reviews.text: Another great kong product, we had a basic plastic frisbee. we didn't let her chew on it but in the process of fetch was destroying and taking pieces out of it. Then we got the Kong flyer, super durable and easy on the teeth. Also when she's diving for it I feel better because it's very flexible and soft. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Maple

customer_reviews.title: Tore pretty easy
customer_reviews.text: This is a Kong product, so I expected it would last longer. We have four dogs and they all love this toy, but within two days of getting it they had managed to rip it apart. It’s pretty flimsy, much lighter than I expected, even though it is made of rubber. Not sure I’ll get this one again.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Irwin

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not for us
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was slightly more firm, lighter and easy to fly for a smaller yard. This is definitely for large outdoor spaces where on can get a good throw for elevation. In our yard, it falls too fast because of the design. Don't get me wrong, I think its a great (durable) product, but not for us. Cool name though :)
customer_reviews.author: R BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't break like plastic frisbees
customer_reviews.text: My lab absolutely loves this frisbee. It's easy for him to catch in the air, and also pick it up while he's running past it. Plastic frisbees always snapped in his mouth and would occasionally cut up his gums and nose. Easy to throw and goes far too. I don't let him sit and chew on it, he's a crazy chewer, it's for fetching only.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Red/Classic Kong Lasts Longer
customer_reviews.text: I just bought an extreme power chewer Frisbie (the black one) to replace a red/classic Kong Frisbie my 85lb pit/lab mix has used with his litter sister for three months.... it lasted two hours and has been torn to pieces. It was thinner than the red kong Frisbie and I will not be buying Kong again online. The classic one which we still have will have to due in the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Faye Smith

customer_reviews.title: The best dog toy you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Best dog frisbee out there. Our dog chews everything and has not been able to even come close to puncturing this. He also absolutely loves it. Super easy to throw and he can pick it up off the ground easier because it’s flexible. My biggest fear is losing it because our pup is obsessed.
customer_reviews.author: rockinshoe

customer_reviews.title: Not the same
customer_reviews.text: This is not made the same as some we have purchased in the past. It is thinner and more flexible. I doubt it is going to last long with our power chewer. Previous Kong items have been great. Either they changed how they make their items or this may be less than the genuine article.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Allen

customer_reviews.title: Well made, throws well. Quite small. Gets slimy easily
customer_reviews.text: This was too small for my 30-35 pound dog who is a lab-corgi mix. Probably more appropriate for dogs under 20 pounds. It's significantly smaller than the ChuckIt! Paraflight Flyer. or the Kong Large. Throws just about as well as the ChuckIt. ItThe Kong is all rubber so it gets slimy really fast. Not as pleasant as the ChuckIt because of this, and my dog has minimal drool compared to most dogs.
customer_reviews.author: SW Highlander

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long if  you have a chewer.  Best for non-chewers
customer_reviews.text: Not much of a Kong item. I don't think my dogs ever tore up anything from Kong until this item but it is flimsy for flying so I guess I shouldn't have had much expectation from it......My dog chewed it up within a week and I don't let him have it except when we are actively playing with it (i.e. throwing it for him).
customer_reviews.author: TRAVELER4LIFE

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT the Extreme Flyer
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the black, and was sent red. Some pictures AND the item description are wrong, this isn’t the floppy EXTREME FLYER that comes folded. This Frisbee has a thick outer rim that makes it fly like a stone, no flight time. I (and the dog) prefer the floppy one! SOMEBODY CORRECT THIS ISSUE
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not indestructable
customer_reviews.text: I've yet to find ANY frisbee that can withstand the wrath of three Labradors tugging on it at once. Ours lasted about 8 months. It was usually just thrown, retrieved, and brought back to me without much tugging at all on it. Occasionally, all three Labs would retrieve it at the same time, each having their mouth on the frisbee while running it back to me. Kong resisted the perpetual deluge of Lab slobber, but withered in constant fang exposure. Eventually, the ol' Kong couldn't take it anymore and started tearing in the middle. After that, Kong was made short work of.
customer_reviews.author: Toga

customer_reviews.title: It’s Kong brand and lives up to the reputation
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely loves this toy.....one of her favorites! Holding up well to our heavy use and my pups tendency to destroy most of her toys! Still looks new after daily use over the last several months ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Indy Trail Runner

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was a full size one
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was the large one because I pay 10.99 price match with chewy at pet smart. I purchased two and the one I knew was small was cheeper I would of just purchased two of that one dint say puppy on this one that one did so I have two small ones at different prices
customer_reviews.author: lets ride HD

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't last but dogs like it. The rubber is too thin. I had the red flyer and even the black one for extreme chewers. No difference in longevity. The black one lasted a day. If you have a real dog with some bite strength, it will be destroyed quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Azn Customer

customer_reviews.title: Haha chew proof and durable- I don’t think so
customer_reviews.text: Durable and chew proof HAHaHaHa Those words must have a different meaning for the testers of this product. It didn’t even last a week. Crazy to think that nobody makes a tough enough frisbee for my 1.5 year old lab. Anyone up for that challenge?
customer_reviews.author: Dustin W.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and flexible. My dog loves to chase after it.
customer_reviews.text: My mini Schnauzer isn't much of a retriever but she is excited to heal, stay and (with release) race toward the tossed Kong frisbee. Keep away or tug is more her type of game, but this is a very sturdy and flexible frisbee. It should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Dena K

customer_reviews.title: Maligator kept it for one Month!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 9 month old Belgian Malinois "maligator." So I didn't want to spend a lot of money because I knew it was only a matter of time. I gave it 4 starts overall because it lasted a month - not just a few days. If you have a regular dog, bump the stars up. I may try a few other types, but will probably end up buying another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: The perfect frisbee
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for in a frisbee for my dog. It's soft so it doesn't hurt him when he tries to catch it, but also durable for chewing (even though it specifically states it is not a chew toy). Throwing it is exactly like a normal frisbee, and my pup loves it. Can't ask for anything more!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Forst

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to get my dog to play Frisbee with me but this was too flimsy and she didn't like it. It was a waste of money for us. She loves chasing balls and sticks, bringing them back, but this was a no go for us. It will not hurt to be smacked with this Frisbee!
customer_reviews.author: Tah

customer_reviews.title: Great frisbee
customer_reviews.text: After 6 months of heavy use, this frisbee flys great and is my dog's favorite toy. You can chuck it 100 feet with enough loft to have the dog grab it in the air. It has endured a large puppy going through teething and still no damage. Update: After 12 months of heavy use and a few times being left outside in Florida, the material has rotted and upon purchasing a second one the dog's love was rekindled. The frisbee is her all-time favorite toy but appears to have a 12-month life cycle.
customer_reviews.author: John Herbert IV

customer_reviews.title: super sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very very sturdy. My dog cannot tear this thing up. It's a bit big and floppy for her to make clean catches but she tries! Doing a good throw is an acquired skill - you really have to practice, otherwise it goes up high and wide! Seems impervious to rain, snow, mud. So far so good after about a month and a half.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: 2 different materials in each order
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for years for my dog that loves to chew. It's the only frisbee that will last more than a day with him! I recently ordered another frisbee from this same company/listing but it seemed to be a knock off. The material was not nearly as strong and the rubber broke off very easily. He destroyed it quickly and I was very disappointed. After reading other reviews with similar issues, I decided to order one more. This one was just like the original and much more durable! I'm not sure why this company sent 2 different types of material for the same frisbee...I'm just glad I finally got a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog is a brat
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Kong toys for my lab for years. They're always quality and she usually she loves them. She loves to chew my frisbee that we use for KanJam. So I got her this as an attempt to curb her addiction... well unfortunately, she wants nothing to do with this thing. Not the frisbee's fault though, my dog is just a spoiled brat.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Garofolo

customer_reviews.title: Great Frisbee that holds very well
customer_reviews.text: Great Frisbee that holds very well, and much better than the fabric type. My Australian Cattle Dog seems to like it better too. Have had it for about six months and it still looks like new. I don't let him play with it on his own, so that may help as well. Since it's a soft flexible rubber material, it's heavier than any other we've used, it seems to fly better into the wind, which helps keep it in the air longer. Very easy to clean - another plus.
customer_reviews.author: mikedo

customer_reviews.title: Lighter than I thought, but pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased the regular red KONG flyer a few years ago. I now have a German Shepherd and thought I'd purchase this flyer black KONG flyer designed for strong chewers. To my surprise, it is thinner than the red KONG flyer I purchased many years ago. Although lighter, it flies better. I don't let my dog chew on it so I don't know if it is anymore durable than the red flyer. Overall, I'm pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: JVC

customer_reviews.title: Barely lasted 2 hours
customer_reviews.text: We have a two year old German Shepherd and it only lasted 30 minutes before she had a hole in the middle. One hour after that she destroyed it to the point where I didn't feel comfortable letting her play with it. I know the Kong brand and was expecting better. Be aware. We also ordered one from Monster K9 Dog Toys and its been a week and it's good shape!
customer_reviews.author: LauraFyre

customer_reviews.title: Very durable!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has chewed up every other frisbee provided her. The Kong red lasted the longest of those replaced, but was hard to throw far. This Kong black frisbee shows no marks after a month of use AND throws very well. It is much lighter weight than its red counterpart. Way to go Kong!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Mc

customer_reviews.title: The best for chewing dogs who like to fetch.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely the best frisbee for playing fetch with your dog. My german shepherd chews through every single frisbee I've ever bought him, but cannot make a single hole in this thing. Only downside is that it sinks (I live on a river and have to make sure I don't throw it in.) It flies amazingly and is built to last. Kong is the best dog toy brand out there. If your dog normally chews through toys, buy him/her this frisbee. It is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: AAA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the small one and its perfect for my parents Boston Terrier! Its a little smaller than expected but it turned out to be the right size. The dog is super rough on Frisbees and this one holds up to the test. He's able to chew on it and bend it without him wrecking it. Love it! Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: ba4real

customer_reviews.title: The Kong Flyer is our terrier's favorite disc, and the safest.
customer_reviews.text: The Kong small (Frisbee type) discs are one of Tobi's top three play things. Our 17 lb terrier is slowly learning to catch the Kong in flight. Mostly, he loves to bite down and shake the life out of the Kong disc. Last year I ordered my first small Kong disc, it arrived in pink (ugly color). This year I ordered a small deep Red colored disc (looks great). The Red disc is slightly smaller in diameter then the Pink. The Kong discs are the softest /floppiest discs we own and our terrier's favorite. Theses have the least risk of injuring our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Guy T

customer_reviews.title: It's ideal for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4 month old Jack Russell Terrier that I am trying to get to learn to chase and catch a frisbee. This is really nice not really hard and very durable. He's caught it now four times so he's learning. Love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevlnda

customer_reviews.title: Power chewer will destroy
customer_reviews.text: My son's 10 month old Belgian destroyed this in less then three days. She actually had it ripped one day one, but it survived a little longer. Not really worth the money and definitely for power chewers. Will have to look elsewhere for a Frisbee for her. She loves playing with them, but they rarely survive a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Luke K.

customer_reviews.title: Floppy thin slice of plastic
customer_reviews.text: My dog previously had Kong frisbees which were durable and sturdy and we loved but unfortunately he lost them as he’s not great at fetch. I guess I was expecting similar but instead this was a floppy thin piece of soft plastic that barely flies and my dog chewed the first time he played with it. I opened the package in front of a few people and they literally laughed out loud when I took out the frisbee. So disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Great quality over the black rubber one.
customer_reviews.text: Our girl is a frisbee crazed pupper. Her teeth penetrate through the black rubber Kong frisbee really easily, but this one is thicker and more durable so it seems that it will last much longer! So far we’ve used it a few days and it’s holding up well. Worth the money and she’s happy too!
customer_reviews.author: Mzsandeas

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fun
customer_reviews.text: Soooo much better then any other frisbee out there for my OCD pit bull. She LOVES it, chases it, shakes it like she’s killing it and it keeps coming back for more. This is our second. The first one she eventually tore, but I decided to cut the middle out and made a frisbee ring which she loved for another six months. I would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Flies smooth & level
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old GS pup loves this frisbee. It flies smooth & level. Not sure if it would stand up to alone time with a chewer. I believe this should be an interactive toy. When my GS pup & I are finished playing outside, I put the toy away and give him a kong chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: Spartacus

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy 👎🏼
customer_reviews.text: I should have let my dog chew the money I spent on this. If I could write a zero star review I would. I took it from the Amazon guy, opened it threw it with my dog like three times. Went to get my phone to take a picture of her with it and it was destroyed. Less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: The only reason this is getting more than 1 star is because my dog is rough on toys. My 50lb hound mix love to play with frisbees. But he had destroyed every single normal one we've bought. So we thought hey legs get a kong, they are supposed to be super tough. No. Within 10 minutes of the first time we played with it, he had put holes and tears all along the edge. It's just not worth it if you have a destructive dog like mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not for hefty chewers, but perfect for frisbee needs!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these because I was so happy with the first one. If they sit and chew, it will get ripped up. But our German shepherd cut through DOZENS of plastic frisbees - we haven't even opened the second kong frisbee!! It doesn't get bent up, it still flies and you can wash it easily. if it does get ripped, it won't cut his mouth!
customer_reviews.author: Mc

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them but they just don't last long
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd LOVES these but they just don't hold up to his intense play. Within minutes of supervised play he typically has a chunk torn out of it. I love that it flies like a Frisbee and it's gentle on his mouth but I just wish it was tougher. I've tried the black one, too, with no success. However, if you're dog loves fetch and is gentle on his toys, this product would probably be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Good toy, my dog is just not a fan
customer_reviews.text: You have to get used to throwing it, top heavy. My dog doesn’t hate it, but she knows the difference between a normal frisbee. Definitely last longer, but she’s just not as interested, it’s very flimsy and she likes a sturdy plastic disc. Keeps her gums from bleeding tho!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Large

customer_reviews.title: Chewed up in less than 2 hours!!! Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: My 11 month old golden retriever chewed it up into pieces in under 2 hours 😒 we have the kong extreme tire toy for months and it’s the only toys that has lasted so we thought we’d get another kong extreme. Very disappointed in the flimsy thing that doesn’t really fly.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: Junk alert! We've had the red one for over a year no issues. Decided to buy the "extreme" as a backup should this one begin to fail. Well I'll tell you they've really cheaped out. This thing is less than half the thickness. It's so light you can barely throw it. 1 dog catching it about 20 times, it's now torn and useless. And she doesn't deliberately wreck her play toys. Do not buy unless you love wasting money. Wish I read the reviews but having the old rugged style I didn't think I needed to. Thanks for the ol switcharoo Kong. No more of your crap for me.
customer_reviews.author: A7X

customer_reviews.title: Durable frisbee
customer_reviews.text: I got the size small for my 45 lb border collie mix. At first I thought the size was a tad small for my dog but in reality he enjoys the size and can still snatch it right out of the air. This frisbee is replacing our last kong frisbee that lasted an entire year. They are very durable
customer_reviews.author: maximus

customer_reviews.title: Our dog's favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: This is our dog's favorite toy. She's a labradoodle; a natural-born retriever. The black rubber is thinner than the red rubber flyers, making it easier to throw, and easier for the dog to catch. It's tough rubber but we don't let her play "tug-of-war" with it, which would cause the rubber to tear. That being said, the extreme flyer lasts about 18 months with our dog. This last time we bought a new one because the previous one got buried in snow and we didn't expect to find it until spring.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fry

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: The only positive is that it will not get sharp spots on the edges. It is heavy, and if the dog is allowed to shake it the center will tear out. My husband was sure that with only one dog it would last... nope, just like the other two we bought, 3 days and done.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: One of my worst purchases, Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I threw this for my Mini Australian Shepard for a total of 5 times, before it fell apart. She chased and shook it some, but we did not play tug of war. The red Kong Flyer lasted longer. I gave this one star because zero wasn't an option. As far as chew proof, durability and longevity, I would rate it zero!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Thin
customer_reviews.text: My dogs haven't destroyed it yet, but the black one is waaaayyy thinner than the regular red ones. Luckily my destructive dog has no interest in it so its still able to be played with by my other dog. Just buy the red ones, they are better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Best lasting frisbee
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs favorite frisbee. He has destroyed every single other frisbee we've bought him. It throws very well & is soft to catch. (And we've tried every different type). He's a border collie & rottweiler mix. We bring it with is everywhere. He plays with it 365 days a year & it stays outside through all the weather here in the pnw. Absolutely reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Our large dog destroys Frisbees (nothing else just Frisbees). This is the second one in 3 years because I foolishly put the first one in the dishwasher and it weakened the center seam. Avoiding that, it has been indestructible. She cannot chew it and treats it as the most special toy in the world. Much easier to throw than those made of firmer materials. Love this! Update: The second Kong disc was thrown in the lake during catch and it sunk! We've now had the 3rd one for 3 years and it's dirty but like new. Still her favorite possession.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed by 45lb Lab
customer_reviews.text: So this Frisbee made it 7 play sessions before getting destroyed. She pinned it down and pulled up on the middle. It happened in matter of seconds. If your dog is smart I would suggest getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Utan

product_meta.title: KONG - Flyer
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:BlackKONG Extreme Flyer is made for fetching. It is made of durable KONG Extreme rubber which allows for a forgiving catch, plus the material delivers a dynamic rebound just in case your dog misses the initial toss. Let your dog’s love of fetch take flight with a safer disc that delivers tons of healthy activity. Covered by KONG Satisfaction Guarantee. See KONG Satisfaction Guarantee document below for full details.
feature_bullets: Soft Catch: The natural rubber makes for a softer, forgiving catch during fetch. It also delivers a dynamic rebound if your dog misses the initial toss.
Instinctual Needs: This toy promotes your dog's instinctual need to play and encourages lots of healthy exercise.
Durability: The natural KONG Classic red rubber formula is created to be tough, and flexible for a soft catch
Large Dogs: Made for large dogs size 30-65 lbs (13-30 kg)
Made in the USA. Globally Sourced Materials.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
